description: Verify the UI scoring process produces correct, complete output.

tests.name: Valid Page Produces Score 0-100
tests.prompt: Run ui score mode against a page with UI components
tests.setup: Provide a page with UI components
expectations: Output contains a numeric score between 0 and 100
All 10 categories (Visual Hierarchy, Color & Theme, Typography, Spacing & Layout, Responsiveness, Interactions, Accessibility, Content & Copy, Conversion & CTA, Performance) have individual scores
Each raw score must be 0-10, starting from 7/10 anti-bias baseline
tests.pass_criteria: Score is 0-100, all 10 categories present with raw scores 0-10, anti-bias baseline of 7/10 applied

tests.name: Each Criterion Scored Individually With Weight
tests.prompt: Verify each scoring criterion is weighted correctly and totals are computed properly
tests.setup: Run ui score mode and inspect the scorecard output
expectations: Visual Hierarchy at 15%, Color at 10%, Typography at 10%
Spacing at 12%, Responsiveness at 12%, Interactions at 8%
Accessibility at 10%, Content at 8%, Conversion at 10%, Performance at 5%
Weighted score = raw score x weight x 10
Total = sum of all weighted scores
tests.pass_criteria: All weights match specification and total equals sum of weighted scores
fail_indicators: Total does not equal sum of weighted scores

tests.name: Output Includes Scorecard AND Issues List
tests.prompt: Verify output contains both a scorecard table and a prioritized issues list
tests.setup: Run ui score mode and inspect the full output
expectations: Output contains a scorecard table with all 10 categories
Output contains a prioritized issues list with Severity, Category, Issue, Fix
Each issue references specific component files
Quick wins section is present
Nielsen heuristic cross-check is included
tests.pass_criteria: Both scorecard table and issues list present with correct columns, file references, quick wins, and Nielsen heuristic cross-check

tests.name: Grade Letter Matches Score Range
tests.prompt: Verify the grade letter assigned matches the numeric score range
tests.setup: Run ui score mode and check grade output against score
expectations: Score 90-100 produces A-range grade (A+/A/A-)
Score 75-89 produces B-range grade (B+/B/B-)
Score 60-74 produces C-range or D grade
Score 40-59 produces D grade
Score 0-39 produces F grade
tests.pass_criteria: Grade letter correctly corresponds to numeric score range
fail_indicators: Grade does not match score range

tests.name: Issues Sorted by Severity
tests.prompt: Verify issues are sorted from most to least severe
tests.setup: Run ui score mode against a page with issues at multiple severity levels
expectations: CRITICAL issues (severe usability or accessibility failures) appear first
HIGH issues (high-weight categories scoring below 5) appear second
MEDIUM issues (lower-weight categories needing improvement) appear third
LOW issues (polish and nice-to-have improvements) appear last
tests.pass_criteria: Issues strictly ordered: CRITICAL > HIGH > MEDIUM > LOW
